items.title: 'Historic': WHO releases first guidance on drugs like Ozempic for treating obesity
items.summary: The World Health Organization has published its first set of recommendations regarding medications for weight loss.

items.title: 'Desperately sad': Farmer dies fighting WA bushfire as more areas burn
items.summary: Parts of Western Australia remain under a total fire ban as blazes continue near Geraldton and Ravensthorpe.

items.title: Pope Leo delivers message of hope to youth in crisis-hit Lebanon
items.summary: Pope Leo has described his trip to Lebanon, racked by years of conflict, political paralysis and economic misery, as a mission of peace.

items.title: A parent’s guide to help teens adjust to social media age restrictions
items.summary: Australia is restricting access to social media accounts for under-16s, and many families are wondering what it means in practice. While the rules place responsibility on tech platforms rather than young people or their parents, the changes may still create stress for teens who rely on social media to stay connected. Find out how the ban will work, why connection still matters, and how experts suggest supporting young people through the transition.

items.title: Government announces long-awaited national plan for artificial intelligence
items.summary: The plan is aimed at "making sure technology serves Australians, not the other way around", Industry Minister Tim Ayres said.

items.title: Zelenskyy, Macron push for united front as Ukraine awaits tough talks with Trump
items.summary: Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with Emmanuel Macron and spoke with other European leaders ahead of further "challenging" negotiations with the US.

items.title: Hong Kong officials say mesh on apartments failed fire safety standards as death toll rises
items.summary: Officials have also said that fire alarms were not working properly, as questions swirl over whether the inferno was preventable.

items.title: 'Moving in the wrong direction': The debt divide leaving some Australians even worse off
items.summary: Housing remains the top financial concern for Australians amid unrelenting cost of living issues, though many are continuing to save.

items.title: Australia monitoring Chinese 'task group' in the Philippine Sea
items.summary: The news came as Acting Prime Minister Richard Marles announced a huge shake-up of Australia's defence department.

items.title: Militaries step in to aid Asia flood victims as death toll passes 1,000
items.summary: Separate weather systems last week led to deadly floods and landslides in Sri Lanka, Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia.

items.title: 'Can't afford to ask nicely anymore': Why Myles locked himself to port equipment
items.summary: NSW Police have charged more than 150 people in relation to the protests.

items.title: 'He's been buried twice': Why John had to open his brother's grave after 49 years
items.summary: Recent findings of a coronial inquest confirmed that 177 human specimens were handed to the University of Tasmania without consent.

items.title: NT’s domestic violence crisis continues to kill Aboriginal women, one year on from landmark inquest
items.summary: Aboriginal health leaders say more Aboriginal women have been killed and violence rates continuing to rise.

items.title: 'I remember being so scared': Chrissy's traumatic three-year battle to have her ex convicted
items.summary: Chrissy says she faced traumatic experiences navigating the justice system.

items.title: He vowed to uncover harm. Police allege he led a satanic child sex abuse material ring
items.summary: Four men from an alleged Sydney-based paedophile network — including the founder of an independent news website — were arrested last week.

items.title: Rules on this common travel item change today. Here’s why they’re risky
items.summary: Rules around power banks are increasingly tightening after a string of incidents. How do you know if yours is safe?

items.title: Global arms giants hit record $1 trillion in revenue, fuelled by Ukraine and Gaza wars
items.summary: An increase in national defence spending also contributed to a surge in sales for the world's largest arms-makers.

items.title: Government to target 'dark patterns' behind hidden fees and subscription traps
items.summary: The government wants to outlaw drip pricing and subscription traps, targeting manipulative online tactics that cost Australians millions.

items.title: We found a cache of rare Aboriginal artefacts, telling a story of trade and ingenuity
items.summary: An investigation by Griffith University of the extremely rare site has revealed a long story of Indigenous trade and innovation in the Australian outback.

items.title: Netanyahu seeks 'extraordinary' presidential pardon amid ongoing corruption trial
items.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has argued that his legal proceedings impede his ability to govern and a pardon would benefit Israel.

items.title: Soaring home prices erase benefits of recent interest rate cuts
items.summary: Data from Cotality shows rapid home price growth across Australia has erased affordability gains from recent rate cuts.

items.title: Russian missiles and 'anarchisation': How could Venezuela respond to a US attack?
items.summary: The Venezuelan foreign ministry called the latest remarks from Donald Trump a "new extravagant, illegal, and unjustified aggression against the people of Venezuela".

items.title: Expert view: Will Australia have another Christmas COVID wave this year?
items.summary: Since the start of the pandemic, Australia has experienced an increase in COVID-19 cases during the summer and winter months.

items.title: A new values test for temporary visa holders 'won't hurt', David Littleproud says
items.summary: The Coalition is set to unveil its immigration policy, expected to include cuts to migration levels, by the year's end.
